intro: Benstonea pseudosyncarpa, commonly known as the false sandstone plant, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged oppositely along the stem. Benstonea pseudosyncarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
